title: Select Shelter Site Using BLISS Method
brief: Use the BLISS acronym to select a tactically sound shelter location that provides concealment and safety.
steps: Step 1: Find a location that Blends in with the surroundings - avoid obvious clearings or distinctive terrain.
Step 2: Ensure Low silhouette - choose spots that won't create an obvious outline against the sky.
Step 3: Select Irregular shape - avoid geometric patterns that look man-made from above.
Step 4: Keep it Small - only large enough for your needs to minimize detection.
Step 5: Choose a Secluded location - away from trails, roads, or areas of human activity.
warnings: Avoid flash flood areas in foothills and valleys.
Stay away from avalanche or rockslide areas in mountains.
Don't build near bodies of water below the high water mark.
Check for poisonous plants, snakes, and stinging insects before settling.
